definition: gold and jade in glorious splendor (idiom)/fig. a dazzling sight (e.g. royal palace)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: We enter the temple of the God of wealth will feel the feeling of beautiful decoration.
sentences.chinese: 我们进入财神庙便会感到金碧辉煌的感觉。
金碧辉煌的宫殿使她赞叹不已。

sentences.english: Temple Hall of smart structures, the resplendent, for payment of the fine on behalf of the Building.
sentences.chinese: 寺内殿堂构造灵巧，金碧辉煌，为金代建筑之精品。

sentences.english: The brilliant Big Buddha at Nanshan Mountain helps indicate the magnitude and profundity of Chinese civilization.
sentences.chinese: 金碧辉煌的南山大佛展现了中华文明的博大精深。

sentences.english: Glittering banquet hall can accommodate 400 people at a time.
sentences.chinese: 金碧辉煌的宴会大厅，可容纳400人同时就餐。

sentences.english: There were magnificent gold decorations inside the ballroom.
sentences.chinese: 舞厅里装饰得金碧辉煌。

sentences.english: Love can turn the cottage into a golden palace.
sentences.chinese: 爱情可使茅屋变成金碧辉煌的宫殿。

sentences.english: But now is a resplendent managed to support a large shelf.
sentences.chinese: 但现在是一个金碧辉煌的大架子勉力支撑。

sentences.english: This temple has been restored to its ancient glory.
sentences.chinese: 这座庙宇已恢复成古时金碧辉煌的样子了。

sentences.english: Behind many glittering boardrooms lie tales of human misery.
sentences.chinese: 在许多金碧辉煌的董事会后藏着多少悲戚的故事。

sentences.english: Masjid Kampong Sungai Keun Mosque in Brunei is made of white marble and gold.
sentences.chinese: 文莱的大清真寺金碧辉煌，用白色大理石和黄金建成。

definition: (literary) halls (of a palace or a temple)
